Author: jl777c#5810
Content: possible, but adds the need for refunding and also the game might not start...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the way it is now, you can start for sure in 5 blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: after say one hour, you will know all the participants

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, and we can test the highlander tx with multiplayer. it is basically the same as bailout, just that it wins the buyins. it will be easier to test the condition of last man standing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so start 3 players, or even 2, have all but 1 bailout

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then the last one can do the highlander

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in order to prevent just waiting forever for the other player to bailout, if you dont do a new keystrokes tx within an hour, it becomes invalid and you are basically dead

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Oh not rapid games at all ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we assume for small stakes, players wont resort to clock waiting

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so rapidly it goes to last man standing

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Maybe it's possible to modify rogue code to track deathes and force bailout tx in such case?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Just as assumption

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i tried that but it was causing the hangs...I can restore it and see if it works better. as it is the keystrokes that lead to death are sent

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: From my experience waiting for one block after game finishing before bailout helps in many cases

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Actually if there will not be "Press [Enter] to continue" from rogue side after game end I can force bailout process by TUI after player died :troll_thuglife:
So If someone will play multiplayer from CLI - will wait them for one hour if they are so not good people to send bailout after death. And from TUI side I'll try to not left a possibility to be a bad slow guy in multiplayer game

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@Crabby Paddy Seems you don't have dependencies for compilation
Try to:
```sudo apt-get install build-essential pkg-config libc6-dev m4 g++-multilib autoconf libtool ncurses-dev unzip git python zlib1g-dev wget bsdmainutils automake libboost-all-dev libssl-dev libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler libgtest-dev libqt4-dev libqrencode-dev libdb++-dev ntp ntpdate vim software-properties-common curl libcurl4-gnutls-dev cmake clang libsodium-dev -y
```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Then:
```cd ~
git clone https://github.com/nanomsg/nanomsg
cd nanomsg
cmake . -DNN_TESTS=OFF -DNN_ENABLE_DOC=OFF
make -j2
sudo make install
sudo ldconfig```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Did you restart the daemon?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: You have to start ROGUE chain with this freshly compiled daemon

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Do `./komodo-cli -ac_name=ROGUE stop` and then restart

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
And just in case it might be a good idea to clear ROGUE folder (if you mined you may be on fork) 
`rm -rf ~/.komodo/ROGUE`

Content: Do it only if you don't have any ROGUE balance ðŸ˜ƒ
